title.native: 処刑少女の生きる道（バージンロード）
title.english: The Executioner and Her Way of Life

description:
When interdimensional travelers from an otherworldly land known as “Japan” appear, they often bring death and destruction. It’s up to Executioners like Menou to track and exterminate the Lost Ones before they wreak havoc. When Menou encounters a beguiling Lost One named Akari, it’s bloody business as usual… until Menou discovers Akari can cheat death, that is. Even so, Menou has a job to do, and she is committed to her executioner’s mission come hell or high water — provided her newly stirring feelings don’t get in the way.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

Note: The first two episodes received an advance release on Abema on March 20, 2022. The regular TV broadcast started on April 2, 2022.
synonyms: เวอร์จินโร้ด เพชฌฆาตสาวบนเส้นทางพิสุทธิ์

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Official Website](http://choucho-net.com/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/choucho621/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choucho_)__ | __[NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/3416529) | [Instragram](https://www.instagram.com/choucho621/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGK8Fhw3qDEtHaivTsxfGgg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5t7eQ2d1UmzfIr9oWQ538Y?autoplay=true)__

__Introduction:__
ChouCho is a Japanese singer-utaite known for doing vocal covers of Vocaloid songs on NicoNico Douga, in addition to making frequent appearances in anime with original songs.

__Biography:__
In 2007, she initially formed the band Lotus*Lotus (stylized as ロータス★ロータス) while still in high school, the band performed covers of songs from anime, then starting from June 2008 she first appeared on NicoNico with her cover of the song "[Black★Rock Shooter](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3706654)" under stage name ちょうちょ. In 2011, she made her first major debut under record label Lantis, singing the opening theme song to the anime [Kamisama no Memochou](https://anilist.co/anime/10568/Kamisama-no-Memochou/), titled "[Kawaru Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Un9UiVL6Dms)", and later in the same year she reappeared with the opening theme song to the anime [Mashiroiro Symphony](https://anilist.co/anime/10397/Mashiroiro-Symphony-The-Color-of-Lovers), titled "[Authentic Symphony](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzGWaS0lyIo)", then in 2012, after releasing her 4th single titled "[Yasashisa no Riyuu](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hJiMN4Csjw)", she changed her stage name from ちょうちょ to ChouCho. The song was also used as the 1st opening theme song to the anime [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/Hyouka/), which released in 2012.

Her last upload to NicoNico was an album released with Comiket 81, titled "[Little Nostalgia](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm16484379)", featuring 5 songs: Breeze, Beautiful World (Acoustic Ver.), Hana to Hoshi no Monogatari, North York and Under the Maple Tree.

__[Website](http://projectmili.com)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/projectmili/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ProjectMili)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/ProjectMili)__

Indie band “Mili” consists of: Canadian vocalist [Cassie Wei](https://anilist.co/staff/188041/Cassie-Wei), capable of writing lyrics in three languages. Composer and arranger [Yamato Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/168859), with a proven track record of providing music to various artists, such as Higuchi Ai, DAOKO, and Hanazawa Kana. Bassist [Yukihito Mitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/189705/Yukihito-Mitomo) and drummer [Shoto Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/189704/Shoto-Yoshida) are long-time musicians who have gone through both indie and major debuts. Animator, illustrator, and character designer [Ao Fujimori](https://anilist.co/staff/159213/Ao-Fujimori), an experienced animation director, is in charge of Mili's visual artwork.

Mili has written music for popular anime and game titles such as "Ghost in the Shell", "Goblin Slayer", "Limbus Company", "Library of Ruina", "ENDER LILIES", and "Promise of Wizard". They create music in various genres, such as classical, electronic, rock, and jazz, while maintaining a high level of quality. They handle music, visual art, merchandise, management, and business all by themselves. Mili is fully in control of their production and is recognized as a unique presence both domestically and internationally.

They are also producing many songs for anime, game, and IT companies in Japan, Korea, China, Canada, and Poland.

(Source: Spotify, edited)

**Date of Birth:** ?? ??, 1977
**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohirata0110)** | **[Blog (JP)](http://hirataryo.cocolog-nifty.com/blog/)**

**Ryou Hirata** is a Japanese animator and designer, who does prop, character and art design.

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/111209/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kei_globster) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/kei_globster2) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@keirabat) | [Tumblr](https://kei1-glob.tumblr.com/)

Keiichirou Saitou is a Japanese anime director and animator.

In 2016 he graduated from the Animation Department of the Faculty of Manga at Kyoto Seika University. He can be recognized from his work directing both [BOCCHI THE ROCK!](https://anilist.co/anime/130003/BOCCHI-THE-ROCK/) and [Frieren: Beyond Journey's End](https://anilist.co/anime/154587/Frieren-Beyond-Journeys-End/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kei_globster) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/kei_globster2) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@keirabat) | [Tumblr](https://kei1-glob.tumblr.com/)
